original: FORSBERG, Erik August, överingenjör, Direktör, Stockholm, f Visby 16/10 75 av rekt N A F o Ulrika Hammar, gni Agnes Lied-holm. Ex KTH 98, prakt Bergsunds o G de Lavals ritkont 97—98. Anst el. mek fma, S:t Petersb, 98—02, ritkont.ch AB Separator 02— 06, övering sed. 06, v. vkst dir sed. 22. Spec.lär i industri.ekon v. KTH 12—27. Led komm f lärl.väs 10—11, centr. upphandl.-komm 18. Styr.led AB Separator sed. 09. FI uppfinn inom separatorbranschen. Av trycket: Industr ekon 15, De tekn vetensk 21, Investigations as to cutting speeds for Swe-dish materials 29. RNO, RVO, RNS:tOOlkl, LIVA.
translated: FORSBERG, Erik August, Chief Engineer, Director, Stockholm, b. Visby 16/10 1875, son of Principal N A F and Ulrika Hammar, m. Agnes Lied-holm. Graduated from KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) in 1898, practical training at Bergsunds and G de Laval's drafting office in 1897-1898. Employed in mechanical engineering firm in St. Petersburg, 1898-1902, drafting office at AB Separator, 1902-1906, promoted to Chief Engineer in 1906, acting Vice Managing Director since 1922. Special lecturer in industrial economics at KTH from 1912 to 1927. Member of the Municipal Vocational School board from 1910 to 1911, Central Procurement Committee from 1918. Member of the board of AB Separator since 1909. Notable inventions in the separator industry. Publications include Industrial Economics in 1915, The Technical Sciences in 1921, Investigations as to Cutting Speeds for Swedish Materials in 1929. Knight of the Royal Order of the North Star, Knight of the Royal Order of Vasa, Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav 1st class, Member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences.
